 ABOUTAbout CSSA The Cal State Student Association as a student-led organization strives to improve the lives of California State University students by advocating for student needs and engaging students in systemwide, state, and federal higher education policymaking.

Who We ServeAvenues of AdvocacyGovernance StructureStudent Involvement & Representation Fee (SIRF)CSSA Leadership The Cal State Student Association student leaders are elected, and appointed from the 23 CSU campuses, each academic year.  Professional staff and liaisons provide operational support and advise the governing members and officers of the organization.

THE MISSION OF CSSA
The Cal State Student Association (CSSA) as a student-led organization strives to improve the lives of California State University (CSU) students by advocating for student needs and engaging students in systemwide, state, and federal higher education policymaking.
0Students0Campuses0United VoiceAbout CSSAWE ARE LED BY AND REPRESENT STUDENTS OF
CALIFORNIA STATE UNIVERSITY
Campus & Associated Students (Inc.) WebsitesMEETINGS & EVENTS
PLENARY MEETINGS
CSSA plenary meetings consist of committee meetings and meetings of the board of directors. Agenda’s of these meetings are posted at least 72 hours before the start of the corresponding meeting per Gloria Romero Open Meetings Act of 2000. To receive notice of our postings and other important CSSA information please subscribe to our public mailing list.
